definition: an organized company of singers (as in a church service)
examples: greeted by a large male choir wearing red bowties and singing carols

definition: a group of instruments of the same class
an organized group of persons or things
examples: … travels with a suite of assistants and a choir of publicists.

definition: the part of a church occupied by the singers or by the clergy, the part of a church where the services are performed
a group organized for ensemble speaking
to sing or sound in chorus or concert
